item.title: G7 summit: Dominic Raab says EU's attitude to Northern Ireland 'offensive'
item.description: The foreign secretary says the EU characterises Northern Ireland "as somehow a separate country".

item.title: G7 to agree tough measures on burning coal to tackle climate change
item.description: It comes as Sir David Attenborough warns humans may be about to destabilise the entire planet.

item.title: Covid-19: Hospital data key to 21 June lockdown end, says Raab
item.description: Dominic Raab says the decision depends on breaking the link between cases and hospital admissions.

item.title: Christian Eriksen: Danish midfielder remains stable in hospital and sends greetings to team-mates
item.description: Christian Eriksen remains stable in hospital and has sent his greetings to his national team-mates, say Danish football officials.

item.title: Couples may lose thousands if wedding rules don't change
item.description: Rules on weddings were to be relaxed on 21 June, but a rise in Covid cases could ruin 'the big day'.

item.title: G7 summit: China says small groups do not rule the world
item.description: The G7 leaders, who are meeting in England, have sought a unified position over China's rise.

item.title: Israel's Netanyahu poised to lose power to new government
item.description: Israel's long-term leader is set to be unseated by a coalition of parties which united against him.

item.title: New Zealand beat England to take Test series
item.description: England's dismal second-Test defeat is confirmed inside an hour on the fourth morning at Edgbaston as New Zealand seal a 1-0 series win.

item.title: Cardiff cyclist confronts driver who sexually harassed her
item.description: Nanw Beard said challenging the man's "disgusting" behaviour had made her feel "empowered".

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Over-40s urged to get second vaccine sooner
item.description: People in older age groups waiting for a second dose should seek appointments after eight weeks.

item.title: Disruption to shipping could delay Christmas orders
item.description: Global transport of goods has suffered blockages, delays and bottlenecks and won't be resolved quickly.

item.title: In Pictures: World leaders bask in Cornwall sun at G7 summit
item.description: World leaders are by the seaside for three days of talks - and the occasional trip to the beach...

item.title: Christian Eriksen collapse: The heroes who helped save Denmark's star player
item.description: How players, medics and officials all played their part in helping Christian Eriksen after his collapse.

item.title: ICYMI: Squirrel security and an unusual pitch invader
item.description: From a squirrel security guard to an unusual mid-match disruption, here are some of the stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: Tourette’s Syndrome: ‘I don’t want people to think I’m a bad child’
item.description: Ten-year-old Deaglan McCallion wants people to be more understanding of his condition.

item.title: The Papers: 'Miracle on the turf' and six-week window to open up
item.description: Denmark midfielder Christian Eriksen collapsing during a Euro 2020 match is among the front-page stories.

item.title: 'I miss airline meals so much I make them at home'
item.description: Aviation geek Nik Sennhauser recreates the inflight meals he misses so much - even though he hates cooking.

item.title: Belgium 3-0 Russia: Romelu Lukaku pays tribute to Inter Milan team-mate Christian Eriksen
item.description: Romelu Lukaku pays tribute to Inter Milan team-mate Christian Eriksen, who suffered a collapse, after scoring against Russia to help Belgium start Euro 2020 with a win.

item.title: Why 'tiny forests' can make a big difference
item.description: A team of volunteers in Nottinghamshire are hoping the Miyawaki-style forest will help the environment.

item.title: SLS: First view of Nasa's assembled 'megarocket'
item.description: Nasa has assembled the key elements of its powerful SLS rocket.

item.title: Children perform for G7 leaders' partners at Minack Theatre
item.description: The G7 leaders' partners watched a special performance about plastic pollution by schoolchildren.

item.title: From garden chairs to boxes: Five items in short supply
item.description: A combination of Covid, Brexit and the Suez Canal delays threaten to disrupt supplies this summer.

item.title: Euro 2020: Wales v Switzerland draw 'a pretty decent result'
item.description: More than 3,000 miles away from the action in Baku, fans in Wales react to the result.

item.title: Sunrise social: 'It's great for your mental health'
item.description: A group of young people are combating loneliness by getting together to watch the sun rise.

item.title: 'I could be with people and still feel alone'
item.description: It's been a difficult year for US college students. This is Ana Carmona's story.

item.title: Harry Dunn and the complex world of diplomatic immunity
item.description: The death of British teenager Harry Dunn became a diplomatic struggle between the UK and US.

item.title: Humpback whale gulps and spits out Cape Cod lobsterman
item.description: Michael Packard ended up in the marine giant's mouth for about half a minute off Massachusetts.

item.title: Six flashbacks that unlocked a man's memory, and the 80s song that helped
item.description: A car crash erased Thomas's memory - 10 years later, a 1980s pop song triggered six flashbacks.

item.title: Euro 2020: Why England may take a cautious approach against Croatia - Jermaine Jenas
item.description: Former England midfielder and BBC Sport columnist Jermaine Jenas explains why Three Lions boss Gareth Southgate will wait to let his side off the leash.

item.title: Firms delving into sport stars' social media past
item.description: Detailed reports into athletes' online histories are being requested by sporting agencies.

item.title: Pakistan: The man trying to improve women's underwear
item.description: Mark Moore wants to bring well-made, affordable underwear to Pakistan - he just has to get past the men.

item.title: What is Black Lives Matter and what are the aims?
item.description: Black Lives Matter has become one of the most influential movements in the world.

item.title: Covid: Is there a limit to how much worse variants can get?
item.description: The coronavirus has changed and changed again, getting more transmissible each time.

item.title: MH17 plane crash: Horror and hope for families as trial starts
item.description: Four people are on trial for shooting down flight MH17 over eastern Ukraine, but none are in court.

item.title: Andrew Dymock: The neo-Nazi exposed by the BBC
item.description: Raised in a privileged academic background, Andrew Dymock led two banned neo-Nazi terror groups.

item.title: Download: 'We've got tickets to a post-Covid festival'
item.description: As the UK's post-Covid festival scene restarts, fans explain why Download will be especially upbeat.

item.title: 'Absolutely ridiculous' - Peter Schmeichel criticises decision to restart Denmark v Finland game
item.description: Peter Schmeichel criticises Uefa's decision to restart the game between Denmark and Finland after Christian Eriksen's collapse

item.title: From Gazza to Euro 2020 - England's highs and lows
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look back through time at England in major tournaments. From Gascoigne's goal against Scotland in Euro 96 all the way through to the present day.

item.title: 'It's time for me to go for my chances' - Tsitsipas takes on Djokovic in Paris final
item.description: Novak Djokovic goes for his 19th Grand Slam title in Sunday's French Open final, where Greek opponent Stefanos Tsitsipas bids for his first.

item.title: 'Tension watching Wales' game with Switzerland was unbearable'
item.description: Former Wales captain and BBC Sport columnist Ashley Williams says watching his team as a fan and pundit was just as tough as being on the pitch.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Tourists round off eight-wicket victory to seal series win
item.description: Watch highlights as New Zealand quickly wrap up an eight-wicket victory over England before lunch on the fourth day at Edgbaston to seal a 1-0 series win.

item.title: Euro 2020: Danish and Finnish fans spontaneously chant for Christian Eriksen
item.description: After Denmark's Christian Eriksen collapsed during his team's match against Finland, Danish and Finnish fans spontaneously chanted Eriksen's name.

item.title: When could social distancing end?
item.description: Will we still need to be socially distanced through the summer? A social distancing review is advising the government.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The government is yet to decide whether to lift the remaining restrictions on 21 June.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and can I hold a reception?
item.description: Restrictions on weddings have been eased across the UK - so how can you now celebrate?

item.title: Covid: How should I protect myself from Covid now?
item.description: What are the actions we can take to reduce our risk of catching the virus?

item.title: Lockdown easing: Four numbers to look for ahead of the 21 June decision
item.description: The key numbers that offer clues as to whether "freedom day" will proceed as planned on 21 June.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: The Beast: How Biden's getting around on his first overseas trip
item.description: Planes, helicopters and armoured cars - how President Biden will travel on his first official trip.

item.title: G7 summit: Joe Biden gifts Boris Johnson custom-made bike
item.description: The red, white and blue machine was built in record time by a Philadelphia business with four staff.

item.title: Russia's Putin: Biden will be less impulsive than Trump
item.description: The Russian president says he expects fewer "impulse-based movements" from his US counterpart.

item.title: Joe Biden: Unearthing the president's unsung English roots
item.description: An English link has been added to the president's famed Irish ancestry. But is it meaningful to him?

item.title: Covax: How many Covid vaccines have the US and the other G7 countries pledged?
item.description: The US is set to confirm it will give 500m doses of the Pfizer vaccine to the international Covax scheme.

item.title: G7: Climate protesters target Cornish summit
item.description: At least 500 people joined a parade in St Ives, chanting "act now" and "sound the alarm".

item.title: PM gifts photo of Edinburgh anti-slavery mural to Biden
item.description: A framed photograph of an Edinburgh mural of Frederick Douglass was among gifts exchanged by the leaders.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can countries pay back pandemic debt?
item.description: Countries around the world have borrowed staggering amounts to deal with the pandemic. But where does a government borrow that money from - and can it ever be paid back?

item.title: Brexit: What's the Northern Ireland Protocol and why is President Biden concerned?
item.description: Why are there now some border checks between Great Britain and Northern Ireland?
